body_html: @albin84b, the comments by @pkurogerjs on #14719 are correct. Your image bytebuffer is the worng size a float buffer should to feed in a 224x224 image should be 224*224*3*4 = 602112 bytes. Your buffer is a factor of 4 too big. Can you provide your full code changes as PR so I can take a look at exactly what you are doing?

body: @albin84b, the comments by  @pkurogerjs  on #14719 are correct. Your image bytebuffer is the worng size a float buffer should to feed in a 224x224 image should be `224*224*3*4 = 602112` bytes. Your buffer is a factor of 4 too big. Can you provide your full code changes as  PR so I can take a look at exactly what you are doing?
